questions.question: Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?

Who is considered the father of Artificial Intelligence?
Which of these is NOT a type of machine learning?
What is the Turing Test used to evaluate?
options: A machine's ability to exhibit human-like intelligence
questions.correct_answer: A machine's ability to exhibit human-like intelligence

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for finding the shortest path in a graph?
What does CNN stand for in the context of AI?
What is the derivative of f(x) = x²?
What is the integral of f(x) = 2x?
What is the limit of (sin x)/x as x approaches 0?
Which of the following is the chain rule for derivatives?
What is the derivative of sin(x)?
What is the primary function of an operating system?
Which of the following is NOT a common operating system scheduling algorithm?
What is a deadlock in operating systems?
options: When two or more processes wait indefinitely for resources
questions.correct_answer: When two or more processes wait indefinitely for resources

questions.question: What is virtual memory in operating systems?
options: Using disk space as an extension of RAM
Memory used by virtual machines only
questions.correct_answer: Using disk space as an extension of RAM

questions.question: Which process scheduling algorithm is most likely to cause starvation?
What is the main purpose of normalization in databases?
Which SQL statement is used to extract data from a database?
What does ACID stand for in the context of databases?
Which of the following is NOT a type of database join?
Which normal form deals with removing transitive dependencies?
Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for routing?
What does HTTP stand for?
Which protocol is used for secure web browsing?
What is the purpose of DNS in networking?
options: Translate domain names to IP addresses
questions.correct_answer: Translate domain names to IP addresses

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid IPv4 address?
What is polymorphism in object-oriented programming?
options: Ability of objects to take many forms
questions.correct_answer: Ability of objects to take many forms

questions.question: What is encapsulation in OOP?
options: Bundling data and methods that operate on that data
questions.correct_answer: Bundling data and methods that operate on that data

questions.question: What does the 'protected' access modifier do in Java?
options: Allows access within the same package and subclasses
Restricts access to the same class only
Allows access within the same package only
questions.correct_answer: Allows access within the same package and subclasses

questions.question: Which design pattern is used to create objects without specifying their concrete classes?
What is method overriding in OOP?
options: Providing a new implementation for an inherited method
Creating multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
questions.correct_answer: Providing a new implementation for an inherited method

questions.question: What is the time complexity of searching in a balanced binary search tree?
Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
What is a greedy algorithm?
options: An algorithm that makes locally optimal choices at each stage
An algorithm that uses exhaustive search
An algorithm that uses dynamic programming
An algorithm that always runs in O(n) time
questions.correct_answer: An algorithm that makes locally optimal choices at each stage

questions.question: Which of the following problems is NP-complete?
options: Finding the maximum element in an array

questions.question: What data structure would you use for implementing breadth-first search?
What is the purpose of a version control system like Git?
options: Track changes to code over time
questions.correct_answer: Track changes to code over time

questions.question: What is continuous integration?
options: Automatically building and testing code when changes are made
Integrating multiple programming languages in one project
Integrating multiple databases with an application
questions.correct_answer: Automatically building and testing code when changes are made

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a software development methodology?
What is technical debt?
options: The implied cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now
The cost of hiring technical experts
questions.correct_answer: The implied cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now

questions.question: What is the purpose of a code review?
options: Identify bugs and improve code quality
questions.correct_answer: Identify bugs and improve code quality

questions.question: Which of the following is a relational database management system?
What does REST stand for in the context of API development?
What is the purpose of CSS in web development?
options: Define the styling and layout of web pages
questions.correct_answer: Define the styling and layout of web pages

questions.question: Which JavaScript framework was developed by Facebook?
What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function that can access variables from its outer scope
A way to close browser tabs
A security feature that blocks code execution
questions.correct_answer: A function that can access variables from its outer scope

questions.question: What does JWT stand for in authentication?
What is the time complexity of inserting an element at the end of an array?
What is recursion in programming?
options: When two functions call each other

questions.question: Which data structure is used to implement a FIFO (First In, First Out) behavior?
What is a hash collision?
options: When two different keys hash to the same value
When a hash function returns an error
When a hash table is full
When a key cannot be hashed
questions.correct_answer: When two different keys hash to the same value
